description:
Zocks is the AI Assistant for financial services. Its privacy-first platform saves financial advisors 10+ hours a week by automating administrative tasks like meeting notes, forms, intake and account opening forms, tailored client emails, and more. 

With powerful integrations and enterprise-ready controls, Zocks turns every client conversation into structured, accurate data and insights that strengthen relationships and fuel business growth. 

Join thousands of advisors and firms, including Carson Group, Commonwealth, Osaic, Kestra Financial, and Ameritas, that rely on Zocks; learn more and start a free trial at zocks.io.

funding.investors: Lightspeed Venture Partners and QED Investors, with participation from Illuminate Financial and existing investors
funding.raw: Zocks, an AI platform for financial advisors, announced on January 26, 2026, that it raised $45 million in a Series B funding round. The round was co-led by Lightspeed Venture Partners and QED Investors, with participation from Illuminate Financial and existing investors. This funding brings Zocks' total capital raised to $65 million and will be used to expand its agentic AI capabilities.

recent_news: Zocks announced a $45 million Series B funding round on January 26, 2026, bringing their total funding to $65 million. This significant investment follows a $13.8 million Series A round in March 2025 and is earmarked for expanding their AI capabilities beyond administrative tasks to identify new planning opportunities and enhancing enterprise features. In December 2025, Matt Halloran was appointed Chief Evangelist to lead AI education for advisors. The company also announced enhanced integrations with eMoney and RightCapital in December 2025, and it was noted that AdvisorEngine works with Zocks as of May 2025. Zocks released product updates in October and December 2025, introducing features like Document Intelligence and Client Signals. In October 2025, the company was recognized in Kitces Research for its adoption rate as an advisor-specific notetaker.

contacts.linkedin_summary: Drew DiMarino's recent public activity shows engagement with posts discussing AI's impact on enterprises, reinvestment in Zocks | AI for Advisors, and the effectiveness of meeting transcription tools. His profile highlights his role as an AI Fintech & Vertical SaaS CRO with a history of successful exits and expertise in sales leadership.
